title: Maria Luísa Dias Diogo — Council of Women World Leaders

quotes: Prime Minister of Mozambique (2004-2010)
Luísa Dias Diogo became the first woman Prime Minister of Mozambique in 2004
Diogo was born in 1958
After graduating with a bachelor's degree in 1983
she earned a master's degree in financial economics in 1992
serving as program officer in Mozambique from 1993-1994
Deputy Minister of Planning and Finance from 1994 until 2000
Minister of Planning and Finance from 2000 until 2005
was awarded Finance Minister of the Year by the Banker magazine in 2004
appointed as a co-chair of the High–level Panel on the United Nations System-wide Coherence in 2006
appointed to the High-Level Panel on Global Sustainability by UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon in 2010
In 2012 she became the chairperson of Barclays Bank in Mozambique
In 2016, Diogo was appointed by Erik Solheim
